general_advisory: There is a chance of occurrence of light to moderate rainfall along with heavy rainfall in one or two places with thunderstorm and lightning between 10.09.2024 to 8.30 hours IST of 11.09.224, so farmers are advised to wait one more day for irrigation and spraying operation and keep their animals away from any electrical equipment. Drainage of excess water from crop fields and storage of that water in nearby bund/pond for future use should be advised.

advisory: Farmers should maintain 5 cm water level in rice field for proper growth.

After rainfall, there may be a chance of infestation of sheath blight and sheath rot disease in rice field so to control these diseases farmers should spray Trifloxystrobin 25% + Tebuconazole 50% WG @ 80 g or, Propiconazole 25% @ 200 ml or, Hexaconazole 5% SC @ 250 ml in 200 litres of water per acre. Repeat the spray at 7 -10 daysâ€™ interval.
To control the flower drop in cotton crop, application of Planofix @ 90 ml in 200 liters of water per acre after 60-65 days after sowing of seed.

To control sucking insect pest (Aphid, Thrips etc.) attack in cotton crop, application of Neem based pesticide like Neem oil @ 600-800 ml + 200g detergent powder per acre by mixing with 200 liters of water should be advised at 30-45 days crop stage under clear weather.
At the initial stage of flowering, farmers should avoid any chemical application in cotton crop.

To control Fruit and shoot borer in Brinjal, Tomato, Okra etc. spraying of Neem based pesticide 1500 ppm @ 600 ml per acre should be advised at the initial stages. In severe cases, the alternate spray of Spinosad 45 % SC @ 70ml and Emamectin benzoate @ 80 g per acre at 15 days interval should be advised.
If sucking insect pest attack noticed, then spraying of thiamethoxam @ 0.2 g or imidacloprid @ 0.33 ml per liter of water should be advised.
For controlling some diseases like wilt, root rot etc. farmers should use Carbendazim @ 2g or copper oxicloride @ 3ml per liter of water under no rainfall condition.

Prevailing weather condition is favorable for thrip attack in Banana plant so at the initial stage cover or wrap the bundle with jute bag, the area should be weed-free, and use 15-20 no. of blue sticky cards per acre should be advised to control this insect. For chemical control, spraying of Diafenthiuron 50% WP @ 2g per liter (twice at 15 days interval) should be advised.

Mastitis disease is also observed in some animals at present condition due to which milk production and quality may hamper, so some preventive as well as control measures like pre and post dipping with antiseptic liquids, proper sanitation, preventing wet floor surface, feeding during, and just after milking to avoid sitting of animals before closure of teat sphincters, lime application on the resting floor, provide mixture of 2 lemons and 200g sugar in one liter water at morning and evening hours etc. should be taken to control this disease. Fresh water availability should be ensured on the farm.
